loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad is a 28 year-old divorced woman from Rafah city. She is a mother for three sons and one daughter.   For the past years, Suad has been working in her home where she makes some food and sells it as requested.  It used to be ordered for parties and weddings.  It is a good business, but her home does not have enough tools to meet the demand. 
Suad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a big dough machine. This machine will increase her productivity and also her income. Suad will be able to buy all the necessary needs for her home and live in a better conditions with her family. 
Suad appears in the photo while she was in the store for purchasing the machine.

loans.use: to buy a big dough  machine

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica es de la cuidad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de Marketing, y comenta que tuvo que salir de su casa para poder estudiar y ser alguien en la vida.
Su meta es ser una buena profesional, y que ella pueda volver a vivir con sus padres que dejo lejos. Ella está trabajando en una empresa, y cuenta que quiere ser la gerente, lo cual podrá lograr únicamente con sus estudios.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas, lo que la ayudara a poder seguir estudiando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha utilidad.
texts.en:
Veronica is from the city of Villarrica, and is studying for a university degree in marketing. She says that she had to leave home in order to study and make something of herself.

Veronica says that her goal is to become a distinguished professional, and she hopes to be able to go back to live with her parents, whom she left behind. Currently, she is working in a company, and she says that she wants to be the manager, which is a position she can reach only through her studies.   

Veronica is requesting this loan to pay her university fees so that she can continue with her studies. She says that the loan will be very useful, and she is thankful for the opportunity she is being given.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dried fish, fish nets, and an engine

loans.name: Anarbubu

texts.ru: Анарбубу 61 год, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает четверых детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Анарбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анарбубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 4 года назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анарбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анарбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анарбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Anarbubu is a 61 year old widow.  Since her husband's death, she alone has been raising their four children as well as running her own business.  Anarbubu has a secondary level education and her family's main source of income is the animal husbandry business she started four years ago with a purchase of 8,000 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today she has two milking cows and 20 sheep.  Her monthly income comes to 3,500 somi (KGS).

With an aim to further developing her business, Anarbubu applied to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 65,000 somi (KGS) to expand her herd by buying sheep.  Anarbubu plans to invest the profits from her loan in further expanding the size of her herd.  She also plans to save up money for making repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Entisar

texts.en:
Entisar was born in 1972. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Marka with her five children. Her husband is a driver. 

Entisar’s son is studying for a diploma of mechanical engineering in his first year. He is planning to continue his studies to work in his study field after graduation in order to start helping his parents financially.  They are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them in paying their son's upcoming semester fees. 

For this reason, Entisar has applied for this loan. Because Entisar is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture.

loans.use: To pay her son's semester fees

loans.name: Suha

texts.en: Suha was born in 1980. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Salt, with her husband and two children. Her husband is in the military. Suha has been selling children's clothes for six months. She started her project with a small quantity of clothes. Now she wants to buy women's clothes and more children's clothes to raise her sales and income to help her husband in covering their children's needs.  She doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes to resell

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en: Jehad was born in 1973. She is married and has four children. One of her daughters is a student. Her husband is an electrician. Jehad has been making and decorating artificial flowers for one year. She started her project as a hobby in her childhood. She is planning to employ other people to raise her productivity. Now she needs to buy raw materials and the needed tools to make new decorations with her flowers.  That should raise her sales and income and help her husband in improving their living conditions. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and the needed tools to make new decorations for her flowers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Getafe, a town in Bohol, has been known for farming businesses.  Thirty-five year-old Judith is no different. She hails from this place, and farming has been her way of generating income for her family. She is married and has four children, ages 8-15. She requested a loan so she can buy her farming needs, like fertilizer and pesticides. Business profitability is her main goal so she can support her children’s schooling. Any additional income will go to her family’s daily needs, future savings and church donation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish net, weight leads and to pay for labor

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo is a 42-year-old married man. He is also the father of six children who are between the ages of ten and twenty-two. He is from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. 

His income comes from raising hogs and a motorcycle transportation business called "habal-habal." The profits are used to meet the family's needs and to pay for the children's schooling. Timoteo needs additional capital in order to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed, and gasoline for his motorcycle. Through this loan, he will be able sustain his businesses while supporting his children's education. He dreams of successfully sending his children to school so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and gasoline

loans.name: Jay Maa Durga- A Group

texts.en:
In the year 2009, four active women from Junani of Nuapada district in Odisha, India formed a group named Jay Maa Durga to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their businesses. Drupadi is one of them. The young lady of 29 years standing second from left in the photo, raising her hand, is Drupadi. She   lives with her husband; one daughter aged 8 and one son of 4 years old.
 
 Drupadi has been running a general grocery shop in her village for last six years with the help of her husband. She started the business in a very low profile manner with a small investment of her own. At that time her monthly net income was around 2,000 INR. It was very difficult on the part of Drupadi to maintain her family. After formation of the group to date Drupadi has already accessed four loans amounting 10,000, 14,000, 18,000 & 20,000 and gradually developed her grocery shop by adding new items like a freezer for selling cold drinks, etc. 

Presently she is earning a monthly income of 10,000 INR, but according to her this is not sufficient to materialize her dream. As per her statement, she was able to increase the variety of items in her shop but not the amount of inventory. She wants to increase her stock of raw materials. So according to Drupadi, the present loan of 40,000 INR will be utilized to purchase items like rice, wheat, lentils, oil, etc. for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she will replenish her stock less frequently. 

Drupadi hopes to save enough for building a good house for her family as the present house is very small. She has also a dream to give better education to both of her children. Drupadi, with a sentimental mood, expressed her satisfaction that she has got total success due to the timely support of Mahashakti Foundation.

 The other three members of the group are Nandini, Binati and Tapaswini who are running a general grocery shop with dry food making, general store with fertilizer & pesticide, and a dry food supply business respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing rice, wheat, oil, biscuits, potatoes, lentils, etc.

loans.name: Marylen

texts.en:
For 10 years now, Marylen has relied on seaweed farming to support her family. She is 33 years old, married, and has four children, ages four to ten. She and her family live in Talibon, Bohol. 

Marylen is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy straw and seaweed seedlings. With the loan she plans to expand her business, buying farming necessities that will help her be more productive. The additional income will go to her family's daily consumption, children's school fees and savings for her future needs.

loans.use: to buy straw and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Айсулуу 25 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает одну дочку, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Айсулуу - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айсулуу занимается животноводством, стартовав 4 года назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айсулуу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 бычок, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айсулуу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телок для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айсулуу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку дома.
texts.en:
Aisuluu is a 25 year old widow.  Since her husband's death, she alone has been raising their little girl as well as running her own business.  Aisuluu has a specialized secondary level education.  Her family's main source of income is the animal husbandry business that she started four years ago with the purchase of 30,000 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  Thanks to her hard work, today Aisuluu has two milking cows, a bull calf, and five sheep.  Her monthly income comes to 5,000 somi (KGS).

With the goal of further developing her business, Aisuluu applied to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 somi (KGS) to buy heifers to increase the size of her herd.  Aisuluu plans invest the profits from the loan in acquiring additional cattle.  She also plans to save up money to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy heifers

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 31-year-old woman and has been engaged in supplying and making products like furniture out of bamboo. She is married and has three children, ages two, four and five.  Her husband is a farmer, and she helps him with her bamboo business. She is asking for a loan to buy more bamboo that she can use for furniture and decorations. Marites is grateful for a chance to have this business so she can help her husband.

In the future, she plans to innovate and expand her business for better profits.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn does rice farming to support her daughter. She also produces Cherry Snapper fish, locally known as "tilapia" . She also grows spices like spring onion. She and her daughter live in Talibon, a town in Bohol. She works hard to provide for her child. She is asking for a loan to to  buy fertilizer, pesticides and feed for tilapia. Through the loan, she hopes to have a better yield in her farming business. Any income derived from this business will be spent on her family’s daily consumption and future business investment.

loans.use: to  buy fertilizer, pesticides and feed for fish

loans.name: Leinel

texts.en: Lienel is a 26 year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has two children, ages one and two. He has been engaged in fishing and catching crabs for a long time now. From this livelihood, he usually earns an average monthly income of 6000 PHP which helps with food and household bills. Lienel is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing net. He knows that this change will be helpful so he can have a better profit. In the future, he hopes to send his children to school for their better future.

loans.use: to buy fish net

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro es un estudiante dedicado, está en el último año de su carrera, que es la ingeniería comercial.
Es una persona muy dedicada a sus estudios, y comenta que este crédito que solicito es para preparar su tesis, pues es muy costosa y necesita poder cubrir los gastos.
El quiere ser alguien en la vida, es por eso que se está esforzando mucho.
texts.en:
Isidro is a university student in his final year of his degree in commercial engineering. He is described as someone who is very dedicated to his studies. 

Isidro is requesting this loan to cover expenses to prepare his thesis, which he says is very expensive. Isidro says that he is working very hard because he wants to make something of himself.

loans.use: to cover expenses to prepare his university thesis.

loans.name: Laxmi Narayan Group

texts.en:
Gouri, aged 44 years, is a very active lady from the village Tukla of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. Gouri resides with her husband, two sons of 26 and 19 years and two daughters of 23 and 21 years. Gouri has been running a bicycle repair center for the last ten years with the help of her husband. Her husband also sells bicycle spare parts to his clients at reasonable rates. He has very good technical skills in his occupation and his customers’ from the nearby villages trust him very much. He brings cycle spare parts from the nearby town Khariar as and when necessary. That town is 10 kms away from the village. 

From the present business Gouri earns 200 INR per day, which is hand to mouth for her big family. Due to this situation she has not been able to fulfill her dreams like construction of a good house. So these poor situations compel Gouri to search for a credit source for the expansion of her business. So in the year 2013, Gouri, along with three other poor women from her village, formed a Joint Liability Group named Laxmi Narayan and applied for a loan from KIVA partner Mahashakti Foundation for further expansion of her husband’s business. 

She will use the loan to buy bicycle repair tools and spare parts in larger quantities, which will help her to provide better service to her clients and increase her profits. Gouri hopes for the marriages of her elder son and daughter in a respectful manner. 

The other three members of the group are Manjula, Premasila and Malti with footware and tailoring center, chicken and vegetable vending, and general store   and vegetable vending businesses respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing bicycle repair tools and spare parts in larger quantities

loans.name: Maa Santoshi-1 Group

texts.en:
In 2010, four women from Bhuliasikuan village, located in Nuapada district of Odisha, India, stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families with their contributions. They formed a group named “Maa Santoshi-1” to avail credit from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses. 

Sabitri is one of the group members. She is standing third from the right with her hand raised in the photo. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband, one son of 21 years and one daughter of 18 years of age. 

Sabitri hails from a traditional cloth-weaving community. She has been running a cloth-weaving business with her husband. Presently she has three hand looms for weaving saris. Her husband purchases the yarn/thread from a trader 20 km away from her village. They knit 80 to 100 pieces from a bundle of yarn, which costs around 10,000-15,000 rupees. Sabitri has engaged two workers for the initial processing and weaving of saris. She only produces saris because of the demand in the market. Sabitri gets five pieces of sari per day. 

She sells her products to the local traders, who come to take the products from her home on a weekly basis. From this business, she earns a monthly income of 10,000 rupees, which is not sufficient to materialize her future dream. With the present loan of 36,000 INR Indian rupees), she wants to buy thread/yarn in bulk. Purchasing more stock at a time will help her to reduce the purchasing and transportation costs of the raw materials. 

Sabitri wishes to grow her business and save enough to complete her half-constructed house.

The other three members of the group are Snehalata, Baidaihi and Manjula, doing a mobile servicing centre and milk business, cloth vending and sweet items making, and weaving business respectively.

loans.use: to purchase thread/yarn in bulk.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a hardworking man living in Hoima, Uganda.  In order to raise money to support his family, he decided to start a retail shop to supplement his farming activities, which are seasonal.  Like most traders, he is challenged by inadequate capital and price fluctuation.  His dreams are to own a wholesale shop and educate his children up to the university.  Elias intends to use the loan to buy soft drinks and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: buy more soft drinks and general merchandise for resale

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is a forty-four year-old single mother of three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a bar, and the business has been so lucrative that she was able to build rental houses where she now gets a monthly income. Tenants not paying on time and price fluctuation affect her projected income flow.  Her dreams are to own a five star hotel and educate her children up to the university.  Bernadette intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en: Yohana is a 58-year-old married man.  He has five children and lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is agriculture but he also sells farm  produce that he buys from other farmers. He has hardships of unpredictable weather changes and the high cost of transport.  His dreams are to own a food store that can supply his customers all year round, and  to expand his farming activities. Yohana intends to use the loan to buy seedlings to plant.

loans.use: to buy seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell. He is a 33-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Twelve years ago, he decided to set up a boutique in order to meet his increasing family expenses, and the business has proved to be very lucrative.

However, price fluctuations and high rental fees affect his business, while his dreams are educating his children up to the university and owning a wholesale shop. 

Pascal intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en: Rufa is 55 years old and is from Getafe, Bohol. She is married and has one son. She is currently engaged in fishing and raising hogs. This business has existed for fifteen years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fish net, weight leads and crab traps. She is motivated to work hard and earn more so she can provide for her child and further expand her business for her family's better future.

loans.use: to buy fish net, weight leads and crab traps

loans.name: Petula

texts.en:
Petula is a 50-year-old hardworking woman with 7 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She offers outside catering services for parties and funerals. With the profits, she has been able to pay school fees for her children.

High cost of operation and customers not paying on time are her major challenges, while her dream is to expand her business to new towns. 

Petula intends to use the loan to buy plates and food warmers to use.

loans.use: to buy plates and food warmers to use.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John used the previous loan to buy a hair dryer and a hair cutting machine.  He is a 32-year old married man.  He has two children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.  For nine years he has been operating a salon, and with the proceeds he has been able to provide basics to his family.  High rental costs and inadequate capital are his major constraints.  His dream is to own an executive salon in the city.  John is requesting this loan to buy a dryer and a hair-cutting machine for his salon.

loans.use: to buy a dryer and a hair-cutting machine for his salon.

loans.name: Parzaiym

texts.ru: Парзайим 41 год. Совместно с супругом воспитывают пятерых детей. В 2003 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле продуктами питания с арендованного магазина, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 15,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Парзайим имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли выкупить магазин, который раньше арендовали. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Парзайим обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для оптовой покупки продовольственных товаров и прохладительных напитков для последующей розничной торговли. Доходы от кредита Парзайим планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота и накопить деньги на открытие второй торговой точки.
texts.en:
Parzaiym is 41 years old.  She and her husband are raising five children.  In 2003 she and her husband started a grocery business in a rented storefront, with a startup capital of 15,000 somi (KGS).  Having successfully developed their business and winning over regular customers, Parzaiym has an average monthly income of 20,000 somi (KGS).  As a result of their hard work in their business, she and her husband were able to buy the storefront, which they had previously rented.  

With an aim to further expansion and growing of their business, Parzaiym applied to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 somi (KGS) to make a wholesale purchase of grocery products and chilled drinks for later retail sale.  Parzaiym plans to invest the profits from the loan in increasing their inventory and to save up money for opening a second location.

loans.use: to buy food for retail sale

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Elena tiene 37 años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la localidad de Limoncito,  es cliente nueva de la institución ya que es su primera secuencia, la Sra. Elena va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, manteca y levadura por mayor para la elaboración de pan, la Sra. Elena es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, también se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Elena is 37 years old and works making and selling bread. Her bakery is located in the locality of Limoncito.

This is Elena’s first loan with the field partner. She will use it to buy ingredients at wholesale prices such as flour, lard and yeast to make bread. Elena is described as someone with a strong desire to better herself. She says that she feels happy, and is grateful to the field partner for the help she receives to continue with her business, which is the only way her family gets by.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at wholesale prices such as flour, lard and yeast to make bread.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is from the village of Labo, in Ozamis City. She is 50 years old, married, and has two adult-age children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Aside from this, she also manages a general store to add to her income.

In 2011, Cecilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that might help her improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Her previous loan that was used to buy farm inputs was successfully repaid. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items, such as canned goods, sugar, noodles, etc., for sale. She plans to use the additional profits generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family .

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items, such as canned goods, sugar, noodles, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 28-year-old married man with one child living in Fort portal, Uganda. He has been running a hotel business and a retail shop in order to raise income for the family.

Customers not paying on time and and price fluctuations are his major challenges, while his dream is to trade in wholesale.

Robert intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris resides in Gata Daku, Clarin in Misamis Occidental with her two children. She manages a business selling used clothing in their community to make living. She always finds ways to earn in order to support the needs of her children. She had joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she is borrowing a new amount of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more bundles of used clothing to resell. She is hopeful to gain more profit from her investments and plans to save a portion of it for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of used clothing to resell

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru: Толибчон жизнерадостный и очень ответственный парень. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Пока он вместе со своей семьёй живёт в доме родителей. Но Толибчон является десятым ребёнком в своей семье, и имеет много братьев и сестёр. И все они сейчас живут в родительском доме, который не так уж и просторный. Поэтому Толибчон занялся строительством своего собственного дома, чтобы переселить свою семью жить там. Он уже построил некоторую часть задуманного дома, и сейчас хочет начать строить кухню, склад и гараж. Сам Толибчон вот уже как 6 лет работает водителем на местном заводе. Он получает стабильный хороший заработок. Сейчас Толибчон нуждается в денежных средствах, чтобы закупить все необходимые материалы для построения. Поэтому Толибчон обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит для закупа строительных материалов. Толибчон заранее благодарит Арванд за предоставленную финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Tolibjon is a cheerful and very responsible young man.  He is married and has two children.  For now, he and his family live in his parents' house, but Tolibjon is the tenth child in the family and has many brothers and sisters.  All of them live live in their parents' house, which really isn't all that big.  Because of this, Tolibjon started building his family a house of its own.  He has already built a part of the house he has planned, and now he wants to start building the kitchen, storage room, and garage.

Tolibjon has been working as a driver for a local factory for six years now.  He earns a good, stable income, but he doesn't have the financial means to buy all the necessary building materials, and so he applied to MDO Arvand for a loan to buy them.  Tolibjon wants to thank in advance MDO Arvand for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, four active ladies from the weaving community of a rural village called Bhuliasikuan of Nuapada district of Odisha, India formed a Joint Liability Group named Maa Santoshi with the objective to expand their existing businesses by taking loans from Mahashakti Foundation. Dulabhi, the energetic lady of 24 years sitting second from right with raised hand, is one of them. She is very active and always cheerful. Her family consists of her husband; one son aged seven and one daughter aged five years.

Over the last 10 years, Dulabhi has been running a cloth vending business with the help and support of her husband. This is their traditional business. She   purchases ready made garments and saris from a wholesale market 200 kilometers away. Her husband moves to different villages and weekly markets on a bike to sell saris and garments. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR from her existing business. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses of her family. So Dulabhi wants to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business. 

This is her fourth loan from Mahashakti Foundation and looking ahead to the coming festive season, from the present loan of 40,000 INR she is planning to purchase some quality saris and fancy garments to sell. Dulabhi assumes that this will definitely generate a handsome sum in extra income. Dulabhi has a dream to save enough for construction of a good house. 

The other three members of the group are Kousalya, Jhingati and Purnama running a cloth vending business, general store & cloth vending and Tiffin centre, and  fancy store businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing quality saris and fancy garments.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1000 to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $50. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store, such as fish, noodles, cigarettes, slippers, coffee, sugar and salt. She is a very hard-working woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish, noodles, cigarettes, slippers, coffee, sugar and salt

loans.name: Belina

texts.en:
Belina is 26 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1200 to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100.00.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store, such as cigarettes, fish, noodles, slippers and water. She is a very hard-working woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, fish, noodles, slippers and water

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 50-year-old woman from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is married with three children, ages 18, 19 and 23. For 10 years now, she has been into making Calamay (a sticky sweet delicacy made of sticky rice, brown sugar, and coconut milk). This is also the main delicacy of the province of Bohol, where tourists will not fail to buy one when visiting the province. 

She is asking for a loan to buy sugar, sticky rice, and coconut. These ingredients are very important so she can continue her production on a daily basis. The loan will help a lot. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business for better profits.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sticky rice, and coconuts.

loans.name: Everlina

texts.en: Everlina is a 31 year-old married woman.  She has one child and runs a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in town to make a living. She has been doing this for more than two years to augment their living. Her husband is an agriculture technician and is not earning enough for the family's living. She borrowed 8,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit to  purchase more bundles of RTW to resell. She is hopeful that with this additional capital she will gain more return and will be able to use it for the future education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of ready-to-wear clothes

loans.name: Elgie

texts.en:
Elgie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP19,000 through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her abaca weaving business.  Elgie has been in this business for four years. Elgie earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Elgie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elma is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.  Elma has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for making baskets. Elma has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for making baskets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new and sturdy fishing net.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie's  main source of income comes from planting and harvesting bananas to sell. She is 43 years old, married and has two school-age children. They were from the village of Labinay, Ozamiz City. Elvie has been in her business for seven years and earns approximately 8000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Aside from farming, she also helps her husband to manage their transportation business to earn an extra income for a living. Her previous loan from GDMPC which was used in their farm was successfully repaid. Now she has borrowed 3,000 PHP to repair the existing motor cycle for a better services. Her returns from her business will be set aside for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to repair existing motor cycle for a better services

loans.name: Abdugani

texts.ru:
Абдугани 34 года, он родом из города Худжанд. Этот город значит для него многое. Абдугани родился, вырос, учился и женился в Худжанде. Работает он тоже здесь. Абдугани работает мастером по ремонту квартир. Он шпаклюет стены, вставляет плитку, кафель, гипсокартон, полы и доски. К сожалению его работа является сезонной и с наступлением зимних холодов у него совсем не бывает заказов. Абдугани решил дополнительно начать новый бизнес, чтобы его семья не осталась без средств. 
   Его друг сделал выгодное предложение Абдугани заняться с ним бизнесом по продаже электронной техники, так как у него есть опыт в продажах. Абдугани решил начать бизнес не с большой суммы. Сумма не большая так как он планирует закупить только двух компьютеров и его составляющие. Для этой закупки он просит кредит, поскольку его собственный капитал составляет всего 300 долларов США. Абдугани надеется на успех бизнеса.
texts.en:
Abdugani is 34 years old and from the city of Khujand.  This city means a lot to him.  It's where he was born, grew up, studied and married.  He also works here.  Abdugani is an expert in repairing and remodeling apartments.  He plasters walls, and installs stoves, tile, plasterboard, floors and paneling.  Unfortunately, his work is seasonal in nature and now with the coming of winter's cold, he doesn't have any work at all.  Abdugani decided to start a new, supplemental business so that his family won't be left without any support. 

His friend made Abdugani a offer to go into a profitable business together selling electronics since his friend has sales experience.  Abdugani decided to start the business using only a small amount of money.  He plans to buy only two computers and their accessories, so it's not a large amount of money.  He is requesting a loan for this purchase since his own startup capital is only $300 (USD).  Abdugani is hoping the business will be a success.

loans.use: to buy two computers for starting a business

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita works hard to support her family. Emelita is married and has a pork chicharon vending business in the Philippines. Emelita requested a PHP14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like pork skin, oil, salt, etc. for her business. Emelita has been in this business for nine years now.  Emelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like pork skin, oil, salt, etc. for her business

loans.name: Florame

texts.en:
Florame is a married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and is 39 years old.  Florame has a food vending business in the Philippines. Florame requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, seasonings, etc. for her food vending business.

Florame has been in this business for two years. In the future, Florame would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, seasonings, etc., for her food vending business

loans.name: Karen Melisa

texts.es: La Sra. Karen tiene 32 años, ella se dedica al servicio de todo tipo de impresiones, en su imprenta que se encuentra ubicado en la zona Barcelona, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Karen va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de ,material para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere material bueno para impresión de buena calidad  que por la falta de efectivo no la podía comprar y el préstamo le hacía mucha falta, La Sra. Karen enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen muchas imprentas por la zona y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando equipos y materiales que necesita. en la foto se encuentra en compañia de su pareja.
texts.en:
Karen is 32 years old and works offering all kinds of printing services. Her print shop is located in the Barcelona neighborhood of Santa Cruz, Bolivia.

This is Karen’s first loan with the field partner, and she will use it to buy materials for her printing business. Karen says that she wants to buy good materials so that her printing is high quality, but she is not able to because she does not have cash on hand. Karen says that she needs the loan very badly, because there are already many print shops in the area, and there is a lot of competition. 

Karen plans to use her profits to continue buying the equipment and materials that she needs. In the photo, she is pictured with her partner.

loans.use: to buy materials for her printing business.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Jose con la misma actividad de la confección de prendas de vestir, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra  de material y refacción de una maquina,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de tela por mayor para la confección de prendas de vestir ,  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Jose makes clothing.  His previous loan went well; he used it to buy supplies and to repair a machine.  This time Jose requests a loan to buy fabric in bulk for making clothes.  He is happy and thankful for this opportunity to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Semillas - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SEMILLAS – 26 está  compuesto por diez integrantes siete mujeres y tres varónes, el presidente del banco es el Sr. Christian tiene 19 años, el se dedica a la venta de variedad de mermeladas elaboradas de fruta natural,  vende sus productos de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Christian va a usar este préstamo  para comprar productos por cantidad para tener en stock para su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, el Sr. Christian enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y salir adelante  solo.
texts.en:
The "Semillas-26" communal bank is composed of 10 members: seven women and three men. The chair of the bank is Christian, who is 19 years old. He sells a variety of jams made from natural fruit. He sells his products door-to-door, visiting public and private institutions, different neighborhoods and homes, offering his products. 

This loan is his first with the institution. Christian is going to use this loan to buy products in bulk so that he can have them in stock for his business. His reason for requesting this loan is to have a variety of products to satisfy his customers. Christian faces challenges in his business such as serving his customers efficiently.  He is going to use the profits to improve his family's quality of life, as this is the only business that allows him to support himself and succeed on his own.

loans.use: To buy products at wholesale.

loans.name: Ranilo

texts.en:
Ranilo is 22-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He is a father of three young children, ages 1, 2, and 3. 

Ranilo has been a fisherman for more than three years. In addition to fishing, he also catches crabs. He sells fresh fish, mostly from what he catches. Ranilo is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy new crab traps and fresh fish to sell. With this loan, he will be able to supplement his daily catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish at the market. 

Ranilo dreams of making his business a success and saving for his children's future schooling.

loans.use: to buy crab traps and fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines, and she also earns income from food vending and a general store. 

Ivy is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Ivy has sustained her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving  money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brown sugar, coconut, and a sack of flour

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 29 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

Jocelyn has been raising cattle for three years now, and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is a married woman living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two school-aged children. She helps her husband to operates a motor transport business to make a living. Her previous loans from GDMPC were used to repair his motorcycle.

Aside from this activity, she also has a banana farm, raising and harvesting bananas to make extra income to augment their living. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for the improvement of her farm. 

Through this capital, she is hopeful of having a greener and more abundant harvest in return for her effort and investments. In the future, she plans to use her returns for the improvement of her house for her family's better living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 25 years old and married, with two children, one in school. 

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricel has been raising pigs for two years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maricel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en: Genelita is married with four children and resides in Panta-on, Ozamiz City with her family. Her husband earns money from his motorcycle transport services while she runs a general store in their community to make a living. She was determined to support her children's future education in such ways that she wants to earn more for this. She borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase more stock like grocery goods, bottled products and kerosene to sell. Her plans to improve her business will be a big help in realizing her ambition of having her children successful in their future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like grocery goods, bottled products and kerosene for sale

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny is 39 years old and married, with two children.  He resides in Ozamiz City. 

To make a living, he operates a transportation business carrying passengers and baggage downtown for more than ten years. He uses his motorcycle  sidecar as his source of income. 

He has borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy spare parts and to renew his motor registration. The spare parts will be used, for some parts of his vehicle need repairs. 

He is hopeful that in the future, he will be able to acquire another unit to expand his business for a better future of his entire family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and a renewal of his motor registration.

loans.name: Illampu Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ILLAMPU  está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Eulogia  tiene 44 años, ella se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de queso y leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Sra. Eulogia  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de leche para la elaboración de queso e incrementar su producción ,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  ya que  proporcionara  buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, la Sra. Eulogia    enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado y su deseo es poder producir y elaborar quesos por mayor y ofrecer a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
The community bank ILLAMPU is composed of eight members, six women and two men. The president of the bank is Eulogia, who is 44 years old. Eulogia has her own herd of cows, and she works selling milk and cheese that she makes. 

This is Eulogia’s first loan with the community bank. She will use it to buy extra milk to increase her production of cheese. Eulogia says that she needs the loan to do this because she does not have money on hand. She says that the loan will be a big help, because it let her buy a large quantity of milk to make more cheese to improve her income. 

Eulogia says that her business faces some challenges, one of which is the ongoing need to buy feed for her cows. She says that she will use her profits to increase the size of her herd, and she hopes to one day sell her cheese wholesale to the various markets in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to buy milk to make cheese.

loans.name: Hara Gouri-1 Group

texts.en:
Laxmi is 30 years old and lives in Tikrapada village of Balangir district of Odisha, India. Tikrapada is a remotely located rural village ten kilometres away from the township. 

The lady standing second from the left with a raised hand in the photograph is Laxmi. She is a very active and energetic lady. She lives with her husband and one son of four years in a small hut. She belongs to a Below Poverty Line category family. The main source of income for Laxmi is preparing puffed rice and selling it. Laxmi processes the rice and makes puffed rice, and her husband sells it by moving from village to village by bicycle. For the last ten years, Laxmi and her husband have been involved in this business. 

Due to the lack of finances, Laxmi is running this business in a very low-profile manner.  Presently she is earning around 2,000 INR (Indian rupees) per month from this business, so it is very hard for her to manage her family and think of the future. So, to increase her business this year, she, along with five other members of her village, formed a group named “Hara Gouri-1” to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

Laxmi has decided to take a loan of 10,000 INR to purchase stock rice and paddy for preparation of puffed rice for a longer period. She hopes this will help her to increase her income and help her to manage her family better than the present status. Laxmi hopes to repair her house and give a better education to her only son. 

The other five borrowers of the group are Guadei with a goatery business, Maharani with a vegetable cultivation and vending business, Suru with a milk and vegetable business, Kumari with a goatery and vegetable vending business, and Purnnami with a milk business. They have also decided to take a loan of 10,000 INR each for development of their existing businesses for the betterment of their families.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice and paddy for preparation of puffed rice.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela está soltera pero tiene un hijo; ellos viven en la zona de Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz
Pamela se dedica a  cubrir eventos sociales sacando fotografias y filmando. Pamela necesita el crédito para poder comprar una nueva filmadora y mas moderna  y así poder ofrecer su servicio con mas calidad a sus clientes.

El sueño de Pamela es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para dejar de vivir en anticretico y mejorar el nivel de vida en su familia.
texts.en:
Pamela is single and has a son. They live in the Bajo Llojeta zone in the city of La Paz. Pamela works as a photographer and videographer at social events. 

Pamela needs the loan to purchase a newer, more modern video camera so that she can offer a higher-quality service to her clients. 

Pamela's dream is to save enough money to move out of her current home and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a newer video camera to perform better at her job as a photographer and videographer at social events.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector has always been an entrepreneur. He arrived in the USA in 1988, after having to leave Guatemala because of political issues. He has been selling vintage clothes and accessories for men and women, as well as toys for kids, for over 20 years now. At one point, he even owned and ran his own bakery. He has always been ingenious about where, when and how he sells. 

Although he does not have a location, he manages to appear all over Los Angeles selling at flea markets, swap meets, and different shows or events. On top of all this, Hector is a wonderful family man and hard worker. When asked about why he loved his job he said, "I have a wife and three daughters. Like every father, I see them as the most wonderful thing that has ever happened to me... It is for them that I try and work so hard. I have faith that with the efforts I make and with the help from a few good people that surround me, I will be able to continue to grow my business."
 
Hector is seeking a $7,500 loan to be able to purchase inventory and for marketing purposes.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and market his business.

loans.name: Erson

texts.es:
Erson, esta soltero pero tiene una niña de 2 años, vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Tacagua de La Ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja en una carpintería como ayudante donde percibe un sueldo minimo, en sus ratos libres elabora muebles de melanina.

El credito que solicita es para comprar melanina y elaborar muebles en mayor cantidad y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y en un futuro dejar de trabaja como empleado y tener su propia carpinteria.

Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Erson is single and has daughter, age 2. He lives in his parents’ house in the Tacagua neighborhood in the city of La Paz.

Erson currently works as an assistant in a carpenter’s workshop, where he makes a small salary. In his free time, he builds melamine furniture.

This is Erson’s second loan with Kiva and the field partner. He will use it to buy melamine to make more furniture in order to improve his income. Erson hopes to one day have a carpentry workshop of his own, so that he can stop being just an employee.

loans.use: to buy melamine to make furniture to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia vive en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Se dedica a la comercializacion de cosmeticos por catalogo. Patricia necesita el crédito para comprar una computadora que le ayudara para organizar inventarios y listas de clientes y tambien en sus estudios en la Universidad.

El sueño de Patricia es poder  culminar sus estudios universitarios ya que ella esta estudiando comunicacion social en una de las universidades de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Patricia lives in the Pasankeri zone in the city of La Paz. She has a business selling cosmetics through a catalog. 

Patricia needs the loan to buy a computer which will help her to organize inventory and client lists, and also with her university studies. 

Patricia's dream is to be able to finish her studies at the university since she is studying social communication in one of the universities in La Paz.

loans.use: to buy a computer which will help her with her cosmetics sales business and also with her studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for house repair

loans.name: Dougnane Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 2 femmes qui habitent le même  village et font toutes le commerce. Fatou est la représente du groupe. Elle a 51 ans, mariée et mère de 5 filles de 25,21,17,12,10,ans et 4 garçons de 30,27,23,19 ans. Elle fait du commerce. Elle a une boutique d'alimentation générale devant sa maison au centre du village. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 40 sacs de 50 kg de mil a 6250f l'un. 3 sacs de sucre a 27500f l'un; 5 sacs de riz a 15000f l'un ; 2 caisses  d'huile 60000f. Ses bénéfice lui permettent d'épargner dans le banc villageois et de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et la nourriture pour la maison car son marie ne travail et elle gère seule la maison.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 2 women who live in the same village and both conduct small businesses. Fatou is the representative of the group. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 5 daughters (aged 25, 21, 17, 12, and 10) and 4 sons (aged 30, 27, 23, and 19). She runs a small business. She has a general food products shop in front of her house in the center of the village.

With this loan, Fatou plans to purchase 40 50-kg bags of millet at 6,250 francs CFA each, 3 bags of sugar at 27,500 francs CFA each, 5 bags of rice at 15,000 francs CFA each, and 2 cases of oil at 60,000 francs CFA. Her profits will allow her to save with the "banc villageois" and to pay for the schooling and food for her household, since her husband does not work and she cares for the household needs by herself.

loans.use: to purchase 40 50-kg bags of millet at 6250 francs CFA each, 3 bags of sugar at 27500 francs CFA each, 5 bags of rice at 15,000 francs CFA each, and 2 cases of oil at 60,000 francs CFA

loans.name: Hara Gouri-2 Group

texts.en:
The village of Tikrapada is a remotely located rural village of Balangir district of Odisha, India. Subidha, a lady of 41 years, lives here with her husband and three sons of 26, 23 and 20 years, in a small mud house. The lady standing second from left with a raised hand in the photograph is Subidha. Her family belongs in the below-poverty-line category. 

The main source of income for Subhida’s family is cultivation, which is seasonal only. Due to this situation, it was very difficult on her part to maintain her family. So, to add some extra income to her family, Subidha herself started a general store in her house twelve years ago. She started this business in a low profile with a small investment of her own. She sells general grocery items like oil, sugar, tea, soap, washing powder, lentils, biscuits, toffees, eggs, etc. She purchases stock for her business on a weekly basis from the wholesalers of the nearest town, ten kilometers away. After five years, she purchased a sewing machine, and her husband started a tailoring center. 

From the above two sources, she earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR (Indian rupees), which is not at all sufficient to manage her five-member family. To expand her business for more income, in the year 2013 she, along with three other members of her village, formed a group named “Hara Gouri-2” to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

Subhida wants to increase the stock of her business with this loan amount of 10,000 INR by purchasing items like lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, etc. Subidha hopes this will help her to increase her income for materializing her dreams of construction of a house and the marriage of her sons.

The other three borrowers of the group are Lalita, Dharatri and Indra, doing milk and vegetable vending, bedsheet stitching, and milk selling businesses respectively.

loans.use: to purchase lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, etc.

loans.name: Clyde

texts.en:
Clyde is a natural businessperson. Prior to opening the 5050 Smoke Shop in Newark, he owned a variety store for a year and a half, selling a small collection of t-shirts and water pipes. He found that the younger crowd in this particular neighborhood demanded these products; he wanted to offer these items exclusively to cater to this customer base. 

The idea to open 5050 began about a year ago, and was developed along with Clyde’s business partner, Ryan, who is also an accountant. Clyde believes the venture perfectly combines their passions for sales/retail and entrepreneurship with event promotion and community relationship building. 

Clyde is always thinking about his target consumer and how to best meet their needs. In the future, he hopes to expand into other areas, such as 24-hour convenience stores, in the same neighborhood. 

The funds from this loan will go toward creating an in-house screen-printing system, which will allow Clyde and Ryan to create their own t-shirt designs. They will also allocate money for shelving in the new store, as well as marketing and promoting an opening event.

loans.use: to fund an in-house screen-printing system and an opening event promotion.

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
Floreta is 66 years old and from Getafe, Bohol. She has two grown children, and she has raised hogs for a living for ten years now. She hopes that her livelihood will help in meeting the needs of her household as her husband works on the farm growing rice. 

She  is asking for a loan to support her business and buy feed for her hogs and an additional piglet. With the availability of this feed, she will be able to focus on caring after her hogs and feed them so they will grow healthy and easier to market after four months. 

Floreta is grateful that in spite of her age, she can still work hard to support her needs.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and have more piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy feed and another piglet

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé depuis décembre 2009.Il est composé de membres qui habitent dans le même quartier et elles ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo,habillée en vert,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 55 ans,est mariée et mére de 03 garçons et 03 filles.

Elle vend de l'huile de palme,des pâtes d'arachide,aussi elle vend de la glace.

Avec le prêt,elle compte acheter 10 seaux de pâte d'arachide,20 litres d'huile et du poisson séché 

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et contribuer aux charges liées à la nourriture pour sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was founded in December 2009. It is made up of members who live in the same neighborhood and who conduct small businesses. The representative of the group is pictured on the far right of the photo, dressed in green. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of 3 sons and 3 daughters. She sells palm oil, peanut paste, and ice cream.

With this loan, she plans on purchasing 10 buckets of peanut paste, 20 liters of oil and dried fish. Her goal is to increase her savings and to help out with the costs of feeding her family.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, peanut paste, and dried fish

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 6 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et font toutes du commerce ,Elles ont une bonne cohésion sociale. Aminata est la représentante du groupe; elle a 48 ans; mariée et mère de 2 garçons de 32 et 30 ans;et 2 filles de 27 et 24 ans. Elle fait du commerce de poisson, et avec son prêt elle compte acheter du poisson frais a 500000f. Elle mène son activité dans le marché du poisson de son quartier et ça marche très bien pour elle malgré le concurrence.Ses bénéfice lui permettent de payer la nourriture pour ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du Banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 6 women who live in the same neighborhood and all conduct small businesses. They are a cohesive social group. Aminata is the representative of the group. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of 2 sons ages 32 and 30, and 2 daughters ages 27 and 24. She is in the fish business, and with her loan she plans on purchasing fresh fish for 500,000 francs CFA. 

Aminata conducts her business in her neighborhood fish market, which is going well despite the competition. Her profits will allow her to feed her family and to increase her savings with the "banc villageois."

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish at 500,000 francs CFA

loans.name: Shamim Akhter

texts.en:
Shamim is 33 years old and a hard-working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two daughters and a  son. Her husband is a security guard by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. 

Therefore for the past four-years, he also drives taxi at night. But currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. 

Shamim has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi.  With the profit her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in the future.  

Shamim desires to provide quality education for all her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business.

She is very much thankful to BRAC and KIVA.

loans.use: To pay for repairing her husband's taxi

loans.name: Erdenesukh

texts.en:
Erdenesukh is a bachelor-degree student who studies in a private university as a journalist. 

He was very curious kid when he was young and always tries know more or to investigate cases. Therefore he has chosen this profession based on his interest. 

Unfortunately, Erdenesukh faces a financial issue in paying his tuition fee. if he does not get this loan, he will miss one year, and there are no alternatives. This loan will help him to pay tuition.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto esta separado de la esposa hace años; tiene cinco hijos todos independientes. Alberto vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja en una limpieza de ropa donde trabaja todo el dia, tambien percibe una renta de jubilado, con estas dos actividades el se mantiene y cubre sus minimas necesidades.

El credito que solicita es para pagar los gastos medicos, ya que se enfermo gravemente y el seguro no pudo cubrir los examenes medicos los mismos que debe hacerlos de manera particular.
texts.en:
Alberto has been separated from his wife for years.  He has 5 grown children.  He lives in his parent's house, in the Villa Nuevo Potosi neighborhood of the City of La Paz.

He's currently employed in a laundry where he works all day.  In addition, he receives a retirement stipend.  With these two sources of income, he supports himself and covers his basic needs.

He is requesting a loan to pay for some medical expenses, because he became seriously ill, and his insurance did not cover the medical exams so he had to pay for them himself.

loans.use: to pay for medical exams that are not covered by his insurance

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
El Señor Jhonny está casado y tiene dos hijos;  es comerciante, vende todo tipo sabanas, frazadas, vive en casa propia, en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito lo  requiere para el aumento de capital para comprar máss sábanas y frazadas para venta a sus clientes, y de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Jhonny es poder reunir el suficiente dinero los estudios superiores de sus dos hijos.
texts.en: Jhonny, who is married and has two kids, is a retailer.  He sells sheets and blankets of all kinds.  He owns his home, which is in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz.  Jhonny needs a loan to increase his capital so he can buy more sheets and blankets to sell to his customers.  This will enable him to increase his income.  Jhonny's dream is to make enough money to afford higher education for his two kids.

loans.use: to buy blankets and sheets to sell to his customers

loans.name: Emilda

texts.es:
Emilda, es Casada tiene tres hijos, vive en casa de familiares la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel secundaria. Ella tiene su Salon de Belleza que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Adela de la misma ciudad en la cual realiza corte, permanente , tintes y otros .
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de trabajo:tintes, cremas,papel especial y otros, para asi poder cumplir con el requerimiento de sus clientes.
El sueño de Emilda es tener un salon en la ciudad de La Paz con todas las comodidades  y asi tener mejores ingresos y calidad de vida.
Es la tercero vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Emilda is married and has 3 children.  She lives in a relative's house, located in the Rio Seco neighborhood of the City of El Alto.

Emilda has only a high school education.  She has a beauty salon that is located in the Villa Adela neighborhood of the same city, where she does haircuts, permanents, hair coloring, and other services.  

Emilda needs a loan to buy supplies for her business, including: hair dyes and creams, special paper for hair rollers, and other supplies.  In this way, she can meet the needs of her customers.

Emilda's dream is to have a salon in the City of La Paz with all of the comforts, so that she could have more income and a better quality of life.  This is the 3rd time that she has taken a loan from IMPRO, and the first time she has taken it jointly with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, creams, special paper for hair rollers, and other supplies

loans.name: Nery Alexander

texts.es:
Nery un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor de 32 años, actualmente vive con su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de edades 9 meses, 9 y 11 años. Desarrolla el oficio de albañilería y además posee una tienda de donde obtiene sus ingresos para sacar adelante a toda la familia. 

Él cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en el área de la construcción de viviendas, entre otras. Dicho ofició lo aprendió, observando cuando trabajaba de ayudante de albañil y después decidió trabajar con la experiencia obtenida. 

Con el préstamo, se le estará ayudando al cliente, para que pueda mejorar sus ingresos  y también pueda mejorar su casa. Utilizando una parte en la compra de material de construcción, para ampliar más su vivienda y el resto lo invertirá en productos varios para mejorar la pequeña tienda que maneja.

 Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y tener una tienda más grande, con muchos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, y así tener mas ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Nery is a hardworking and enterprising 32 year-old man who currently lives with his life partner and their 3 children, aged 9 months, 9 and 11 years.  He works as a bricklayer, and also has a store that generates income to provide for his family.

Nery has 6 years of experience building homes and other structures.  He learned this trade working as an assistant to a mason, and later he decided to work on his own with the experience that he obtained.

With this loan, you will be helping this borrower to increase his income and also improve his home.  He will use part of the loan to buy construction materials to expand his home, and will invest the rest in a variety of products for the small store that he runs.

Nery's dream is to improve his house and have a bigger store with many more products to offer to his customers.  This way, he can have more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve his house and to buy products for his store

loans.name: Melvin Elenilson

texts.es:
Melvin, es una persona muy reconocida en la comunidad como alguien honrada y responsable, actualmente está acompañado; vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo de 4 años. Hace siete años debido a la necesidad de  de ingresos  por cuenta propia estableció una pequeña tienda en su casa, la cual atiende junto a su compañera de vida desde las 5:00 a.m. hasta bien tarde sin ningún problema.
Esta solicitando un crédito para comprar productos de la canasta básica (aceite, arroz, frijoles, etc.) y también insumos agrícolas (abono, herbicidas, semilla), para la siembra de granos básicos. Lo hace con el fin de fortalecer su negocio y generar más ingresos.
Melvin sueña con tener una tienda más rentable para cubrir los pagos de cuotas, satisfacer  las necesidades que su familia tenga y asegurarse un futuro sin muchas limitaciones.
texts.en:
Melvin is a person who is very well-known in the community as someone who is honest and responsible.  He is currently in a relationship.  He lives with his life partner and a four year old son.  Seven years ago, due to the need for income on his own accord, he established a small store in his house.  He tends to it with his life partner from 5:00 a.m. until pretty late.  He does this without a problem.

He is requesting a loan to buy basic needs products (cooking oil, rice, and beans, etc.) and also agricultural supplies (fertilizer, herbicides, and seeds) to plant basic grains.  He does this in order to strengthen his business and generate more income.

Melvin dreams of his store being more profitable in order to cover the payments, satisfy his family’s needs, and to assure himself of a future without many limitations.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products (cooking oil, rice, and beans, etc.).

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando, es soltero no tiene  hijos, vive en casa de familiares la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta nivel secundario. El tiene su vagoneta toyota caldina de color negro y ofrece sus servicios de taxi en la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto;  no esta afiliado a ningun sindicato.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad (compra de motor).
El sueño de Rolando es que su movilidad este afiliado a algun sindicato y asi poder tener mejores ingresos y asi tener mejor calidad de vida.
Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Rolando is single and does not have children. He lives in his family’s home in the Rio Seco neighborhood of El Alto. Rolando finished elementary school. He provides taxi services in his black Toyota Caldina station wagon, in the cities of La Paz and El Alto. He is not affiliated with a taxi syndicate.

This is Rolando’s first loan with Kiva and the field partner. He will use it to buy an engine and to perform maintenance to his taxi. He says that his dream is to join the taxi syndicate so that he can improve his income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an engine and to perform maintenance to his taxi.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is a 32-year-old woman from the municipality of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 7, 9 and 13.

For three years now, she has been transporting passengers from Talibon to other islands in Talibon and Bien Unido using her pump boat. This earns her an average income of 2,000 PHP per month.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy an engine, plywood, and for the maintenance fee for her boat. With a loan, she will be assured of continued business and more profits. She hopes that through her hard work she can expand her business in the future and successfully send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an engine, plywood, and for maintenance fee

loans.name: Melone

texts.en:
Melone works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling soft drinks in the Philippines.

Melone requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Melone would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad works hard to support her family. Soledad is married and has a firewood vending business in the Philippines.

Soledad requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell. Soledad has been in this business for 11 years now, and also earns additional income from her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

In the future, Soledad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Reema

texts.en:
Reema is a 23-year-old hardworking lady. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. Her husband is a Suzuki driver by profession but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore for the past 4-years, Reema has also stitched clothes at home. 

But currently her husband is not able to generate any income from the Suzuki, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Reema has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's Suzuki. With the profit her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in the future. 

Reema desires to provide quality education to all her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very much thankful to BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for repairing their vehicle.

loans.name: Mary Mae

texts.en:
Mary Mae works hard to support 3 children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mary Mae requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Mary Mae is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана добродушная и позитивная женщина. Она имеет двоих детей. С мужем она уже давно не живёт, находится в разводе. И своих детей она вырастила одна своими силами и средствами. Она постоянно работает и не сидит без дела. У Светланы имеется собственная машина, иногда она подрабатывает на этом, предоставляя услуги такси. А так в основном она занимается ремонтом квартир и  домов. Но сама Светлана живёт в доме, который уже давно нуждается в ремонте, но она не может сделать у себя в доме ремонт, так как не имеет достаточно средств. Некоторое время назад Светлана получала в Арванде кредит и начала ремонт своего дома, но не закончила, так как не хватило денежных средств. Сейчас она хочет завершить работу по ремонту, чтобы жить в нормальном благоустроенном доме. Поэтому Светлана в очередной раз обратилась в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта своего дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Svetlana is a good-hearted woman with a positive outlook.  She has two children, and has been divorced for a long time. Svetlana raised her children alone, with her own efforts and resources.  She is always working, she never just sits around doing nothing.  Svetlana has her own car, which she sometimes uses to earn a little extra money driving it as a taxi, but her primary business is in repairing and remodeling apartments and houses.  However, Svetlana herself lives in a house that has needed repairs for a long time, but she doesn't have the money to do this.

Some time ago, Svelana took out a loan from MDO Arvand and started to do the repairs but she didn't finish because she didn't have enough money.  Now, she would like to finish the repairs so she can live in a normal, functional house.  And so, Svetlana has applied to MDO Arvand for another loan for the purchase of building materials for her home.  She is hoping for a favorable decision and would like to thank in advance MDO Arvand for its support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers for her vegetable vending business. Nenita has been in this business for 35 years. Nenita earns more income from a general store.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
