She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more stock of television sets, radios and other electronics. Her business goal is to open more branches to maximize profits, within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan from SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 60,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to increase her stock of television sets, radios and other electronics.

loans.name: Kimunyu

texts.en: Kimunyu is 37 years old, married to Ann, and they have two children who are in school. He has a retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has been running for eighteen years, and he also has a hotel business. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him buy maize flour, rice, sugar and other items. With the anticipated profit, he plans to buy more stock for his shop and his hotel. In the near future, he hopes to expand his retail shop to wholesale, and he also plans to expand his hotel to give better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, sugar, and other items to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 29 years old, married to Dorcas, and they have one child. He has a money-transfer business in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has operated for three years, and he also has a general store. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd, to enable him to increase his M-Pesa float, and he plans to plow the anticipated profits back into his business. He hopes to apply for a bigger loan from KADET Ltd to boost his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to increase the float in his M-Pesa money-transfer business.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Alba es estudiante, está cursando el segundo año de la carrera de Técnico superior en radiología, su mayor aspiración es ser una profesional exitosa y ejercer su profesión en su ciudad natal para poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Es una persona muy dedicada a sus estudios, ya que quiere salir adelante y ser una excelente profesional. solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases, y así cumplir con las obligaciones que tiene y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Alba is a student who is in her second year of studies for a superior technical degree in radiology. Her greatest aspiration is to be a successful professional and exercise her profession in her home town in order to be able to help other people.

She is very dedicated to her studies because she wants to get ahead and be an excellent professional. She is requesting this loan in order to pay for her classes, and that way, she will be able to meet her obligations and keep studying.

loans.use: to pay for university classes

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Nueva vida está en su segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, y también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación en la que cada una se encuentra y asi seguir trabajando por mejorar sus ingresos.
Luz es una de ellas, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo y también lencería. Comenta que trabaja arduamente para poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y que quiere progresar. Solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, como ser lencería, remeras, jeans y demás, y con ello poder surtirse y dar a su clientela lo que pide, además poder ir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nueva Vida is in their second cycle with the female entrepreneurs program.  They are also participating in the poverty elimination survey in order to know the situation that each of them find themselves in, so that they can continue working to improve their incomes.  

Luz is one of the group members.  She works selling clothing of all types and lingerie.  She says that she works hard so be able to improve her family's life.  She is a very hardworking person who wants to make progress.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase clothing such as lingerie, tee shirts, jeans, and other items.  She will use these items to stock up and give her customers what they want so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as lingerie, tee shirts, jeans, and more.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
Rosa Mistica es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo,  está en su ciclo número seis del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante., son mujeres jefas de familia, que se están esforzando por salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que pueden y ellas no tuvieron.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Lucia, quien tiene una panadería en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Ella es muy luchadora y está esforzándose por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Ella pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, levadura, manteca, sal y demás, para poder seguir haciendo sus panificados y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Mistica is from the city of San Lorenzo.  They are in their sixth cycle of the women's committee program where they all work and help each other to move forward.  They are female heads of household who are making an effort to succeed and give their families everything they can and that they did not have.

One of the group members is Lucia.  She has a bakery where she works every day from the early hours of the morning.  She is a fighter who is making an effort to succeed and help her family with her work.

She is requesting this loan to purchase flour, yeast, butter, salt, and other ingredients to continue making bread to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, butter, salt, and other ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 51-year-old married woman with three children ranging from 10 to 24 years old. For the past four years, she has operated a tailoring shop where she repairs and makes new clothing. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. Hellen describes herself as future-oriented. She has successfully repaid her previous 10,000 KES loan from SMEP DTM. 

Hellen is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more material, such as thread and cloth, to make new clothing. Her business goal is to increase her sales and turnover within five years. In the future, Hellen hopes to sustain her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more material, such as thread and cloth, to make new clothing

loans.name: Margareta

texts.en:
Margareta is a 23-year-old single woman. A year ago, she began a business renting Play Station games from her house. Margareta started a business breeding pigs at the same time. She started her business with 600,000 IDR that she saved to buy the pig.

Margareta is requesting a 3,000,000 IDR loan from TLM to buy two pigs and a Play Station unit. She hopes her businesses will go well so that she will be able to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and a Play Station unit

loans.name: Eunia

texts.en: Eunia is 38 years old, married to Gedeon and the mother of two children, ages seven and two. She has a posho mill business in Naivasha, which she has operated for the past ten years. Eunia has applied for her first loan from KADET to enable her to buy bags of maize. With the anticipated profits, she plans to expand her business. In the near future, she hopes to see her family needs fulfilled.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is a 45-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns an unstitched garment business, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs additional capital for the growth of the business. For that reason, Rubina is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy a variety of clothes to sell, in order to  respond quickly to customer needs. He will put aside some of his profits to pay for the electricity and gas bills. Rubina hopes that the loan will be helpful to her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of clothes for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
Rosa Mistica está en su primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10 de ellas están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Diana, quien trabaja en la venta de bebidas de variadas clases. Comenta que siempre tiene muy buena venta y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien, ella es una persona muy dedicada que se esfuerza día a día ya que quiere poder superarse, y sabe que la única forma de hacerlo es por medio de su trabajo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, como ser gaseosas, vinos, cervezas y demás, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas,  y poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa Mistica Group is in its first cycle of the entrepreneurial women's program, in which all of the members took the poverty elimination survey, and ten of them fall below the poverty line, i.e. they have very low income levels.

One of the group members is Diana, who works selling different types of drinks. She states that she always has great sales and this is why it is going very well for her. She is a very dedicated person and she makes an effort day-in and day-out because she wants to be able to overcome her challenges, and she knows that the only way to do it is through her work.

She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of drinks such as soda, wine, beer, and more. This way, she will be able to continue making sales and increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy soda, wine, beer, and more

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 37 years old and married to Jane. The couple has two children who are in school. For the past five years, Isaac has sold charcoal in Naivasha.

Isaac is requesting a loan from KADET LTD to purchase more charcoal to sell. This will be his first loan. Isaac will use the profit from his loan to pay school fees and buy more charcoal for his business. In the future, he hopes to own the biggest charcoal store in Naivasha.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rabbits for rearing.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is an ambitious 34-year-old married man with one child. He is trained in finance and accounts and used to work full-time for a finance institution in Kenya up to the year 2011, when he decided to venture into retail trade since his employment income was not enough take care of his family and his aging mother. 

Simon started a retail shop to sell veterinary products and employed one trained person to work as the shop attendant and offer agriculture extension services to the farmers in the area. This idea was triggered by the absence of veterinary shops and extension services in an area whose major domestic and economic practice is farming. The business has been doing well. He is currently carrying out some research in partnership with a local NGO, on the best farming practices in his region. 

Simon was introduced to the solar lanterns, which provide safe and bright lighting and come with a mobile charging function, by Brazafric green energy marketing team. Due to the recurring high cost and health risks associated with paraffin, which is the commonly used lighting fuel in the area, he saw an opportunity to increase his sales, and raise the living conditions of people in the community. 

Simon appreciates the benefits accruing from the use of solar lanterns, and with the Kiva financing option from Brazafric, he is seeking financing to purchase solar lanterns to stock and sell to the community. He has a good rapport with the farmers around the area and from his assessment, the solar lanterns will sell fast, based on the need for the product and the trust he has gained from the villagers.

loans.use: to buy solar lanterns

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 44 years old and married with seven children. Four of her children are in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, bread, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Roditha

texts.en:
Roditha is 27 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been with her business over 3 years and earns 4,000 PHP. She also has been managing her garden of vegetables, selling its produce in town to gain an extra income for the family.

She joined GDMPC in 2012, and her previous loan used for the farm was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 33-year-old married woman with two children, ages seven and 13. She operates a pharmacy where she sells medicine. Nancy’s business is located in an area that is conducive to business and her primary customers are the general public. She describes herself as goal-oriented. Nancy has received three previous loans from SMEP DTM and her previous 80,000 KES loan was successfully repaid. 

Nancy is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to add to her stock of medicine to sell. Her business goal is to open other branches within five years. In the future, Nancy hopes that her living standards will improve.

loans.use: to buy medicine to sell

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es: Flor, a sus 48 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo. Es una víctima más del desplazamiento forzado, por lo que en compañía de sus hijos llegaron a la ciudad en busca de nuevas oportunidades para salir adelante. Inicialmente se dedicó a vender frutas de manera ambulante en una carreta, por todas las calles del centro de la ciudad, pero desde hace 10 años cambió su actividad y ahora se dedica a vender artículos de decoración en madera en un puesto ambulante ubicado en una zona muy transitada, allí ofrece productos como percheros, portarretratos, repisas, revisteros, entre otros y, en algunas ocasiones ha participado en ferias artesanales; con los ingresos que esto le genera ha logrado sacar adelante a todos sus hijos, adquirió su casa propia y, ha solventado las necesidades básicas de su hogar.  Flor es una mujer pujante y emprendedora, su espíritu de superación la han llevado a buscar opciones para seguir avanzando; por esta razón solicita el sexto ciclo de crédito, pues ha encontrado en esta opción grandes posibilidades para progresar. Con el dinero desea comprar mercancía al por mayor (artículos en madera) y así abastecerse para la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, pues tendrá la posibilidad de ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes, lo que se reflejará en el incremento de las ventas y la entrada de recursos económicos. Flor desea seguir trabajando arduamente porque desea cumplir el sueño de montar un almacén bien surtido, que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, además desea que le permita ofrecer oportunidades de empleo a personas de su núcleo familiar, dando como resultado un mejoramiento en el nivel de vida y el bienestar de todos los que ama.
texts.en:
Flor, 48, is the mother of six children and the head of household since she separated from her husband. She is a victim of forced displacement, so she and her children came to the city in search of new opportunities to move forward. At first, she sold fruit from a cart, going on all the city streets. However, after 10 years, she decided to change careers and she now sells decorative items made of wood from a mobile stall in a busy area. She offers coat hangers, picture frames, magazine racks, and other items. Sometimes, she participates in artesian fairs. With the money she earns,  she has been able to move her children forward, buy her own home, and pay for basic household necessities.

Flor is a thriving and enterprising woman. Her Her spirit of overcoming obstacles has led her to keep advancing. For this reason, she is requesting her sixth loan cycle. This option has provided her with many possibilities of progressing. With the loan, she wants to buy wholesale merchandise (items made of wood) so she can stock up for the upcoming Christmas season. Then she will have the ability to offer a wider variety of products to her customers, which will be reflected in increased sales and economic resources. Flor wants to keep working diligently because she wants to fulfill her dream of opening a small shop that will be profitable and long-lasting. She also hopes that this will allow her the opportunity to employ members of her nuclear family so she can provide a better quality of life and well-being to all those she loves.

loans.use: to buy wood products wholesale.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is farmer from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has five children. Merlinda has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now with her husband. This is the source of their income.
 
Merlinda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. 

Merlinda hopes of making their farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Jetress

texts.en:
Jetress is 34 years old and is married with four children. She earns an income from growing and selling bananas, maize, and beans as well as rearing chicken. Jetress also earns compensation as a Community Knowledge worker (CKW). CKWs are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local areas. This data includes information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. Jetress has served as a CKW for the last two years and she looks forward to renewing her contract for the next three years.

Jetress is requesting a loan to purchase a business-in-a-box (a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a scale) to provide timely agricultural information to her community to improve crop and animal productivity. With the profit from her loan, Jetress will expand her cultivation area and start a retail business in her village. Her dream is to become a renowned service provider of agricultural information in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a scale to provide vital farming information to her community

loans.name: Chelangat

texts.en: Chelangat is a 24-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 2 years and 4. She describes herself as being determined. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes, earrings, and other accessories. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an urban area and she primarily sells to customers on a small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of staff. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of clothing, earrings, and other items for resale. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards and buy a piece of land. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add to her stock of clothing, earrings, and other items.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a 20-year-old, single woman. She describes herself to be friendly. She operates a general store where she sells baskets and other household items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are common citizens. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. Tabitha will use the 20,000 KES loan to add stocks of jugs, plates, plastic containers and other household items and also materials for making baskets which she sells. Her business goal is to have a successful business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will achieve her goals. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add stocks of jugs, plates, plastic containers and other household items and also materials for making baskets

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 39-year-old, single woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 13 years to 21 years. She describes herself to be humble and honest. Beatrice operates a shop where she does printing of documents, photocopying and lamination of documents. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are professionals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of printing cartridges. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a printer and cartridges. Her business goal is to own a van and venture into a transport business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy and successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a printer and cartridges

loans.name: Aracelly

texts.es: Aracelly es una señora trabajadora de 66 años de edad, que desde muy joven conoció el oficio de la confección y lo aprendió de manera empírica y, ha hecho de esta actividad su principal fuente de ingresos, pues desde hace muchos años inició su propio taller de confección en su lugar de residencia, desde allí ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros y hace arreglos de modistería, cuenta con la ventaja de ser reconocida en el sector por la excelente calidad de sus trabajos. Adicionalmente y, para complementar sus ingresos, posee un carrito de perros en el que trabaja los fines de semana, ofreciendo todo tipo de comidas rápidas. No cuenta con un horario establecido de trabajo, pues por su edad, no le es fácil estar mucho tiempo de pie o realizar trabajos que impliquen mucho esfuerzo físico, sin embargo, esto no la detiene para seguir avanzando y haciendo lo que le gusta. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en en la reparación de su máquina plana y realizar mantenimiento de otros equipos de confección, pues ya se están deteriorando, esto le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio y disminuirá el tiempo de producción, logrando así tener más contratos e incrementar sus ingresos personales. Aracelly sólo desea poder seguir realizando su labor como dice ella, "hasta que Dios lo permita" y poder sostenerse económicamente y disfrutar de una vejez tranquila.
texts.en: Sixty-six year old Aracelly is hard-working.  From a young age she learned the dressmaking trade as she watched others do it.  Dressmaking has become her main source of income as many years ago she started her own workshop in her home.  From here Aracelly offers tailoring services and does repairs.  Aracelly has the advantage of being known in the area, because of the excellent quality of her work.  In addition, in order to earn a little more, Aracelly has a cart from which she sells all sorts of fast food at the weekend.  Aracelly does not have a a fixed timetable for her work.  Given her age, it is difficult to remain standing for a long time, or to do work requiring a lot of physical effort.  However, this does not stop Aracelly from continuing to get ahead and doing what she likes.  Aracelly is applying for a loan to invest in repairing her tabletop sewing machine and to maintain other equipment she uses for dressmaking.  The equipment is deteriorating but this loan will allow Aracelly to offer better service and reduce production time. This will allow her to have more contracts and increase her income.  Aracelly wants to be able to continue her work until, as she says, "God allows it", and she wants to be able to support herself financially and enjoy a peaceful old age.

loans.use: to invest in repairing her tabletop sewing machine and to maintain other equipment she uses for dressmaking.

loans.name: Noura

texts.en:
Noura is a 39-year-old married mother of three children. Since 2007, she has sold clothing, perfumes, accessories, and other products from her house.  Noura is a hard worker who has put much effort into improving her business to make sure that she will be capable of supporting her husband and maintaining her family’s living and socioeconomic situation.

Noura is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tools, decorating products, clothing, and living room furniture to improve her business. She hopes to release a new autumn and winter collection. Noura used her previous loan to develop her souvenir business and she proved to be a good standing borrower. In the future, she hopes to work hard to expand her business, increase her working capital, and move to a larger location.

loans.use: to buy tools, decorating products, clothing, and furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, vegetables and others.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 47 year old woman from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is married and has one grown child.

She runs a sari-sari (retail) store. She sells various items like eggs, cooking oil, shampoo, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks. Her business started more than five years ago. Aside from running a store, she raises hogs for additional income.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted goods like beverages, toiletries and various dry goods. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability to improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods like beverages, toiletries and various dry goods.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man with nine children. For the past three years, he has sold livestock. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are from many places. James describes himself as honest. His biggest business challenge is his lack of funds.

James is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to add a stock of goats, cows, and other livestock to sell. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. His business goal is to open a slaughterhouse within five years. In the future, James hopes to support his family.

loans.use: to buy goats, cows, and other livestock to sell

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a 54-year-old married woman. She has 7 children, ages ranging from 7 to 30 years. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a grinding mill where she sells maize flour. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. She also runs another business of selling cows and goats to earn extra income.

Her business is located in a competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of maize. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more maize for grinding to produce maize flour to sell. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to buy cows and goats to sell

loans.use: to add more maize for grinding to produce maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 44 years old, married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lorna has a pottery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 24 years. Lorna requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her pottery.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to send her children to college and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 36 years old, married and blessed with 2 children, ages 1 and 4 years old. He runs a hotel business and is also a farmer. He has been in the hotel business for 6 years now. 

Elijah will be using this loan to purchase baking flour, cooking oil and hotel utensils for use in his business. He plans to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to open another business as well as invest in farming. 

Having paid his previous loan successfully, this will be his second loan term. Elijah's hopes and dreams for the future are to open more businesses and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour and hotel utensils.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has one child who is 1 year old. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a farm where he grows potatoes for sale. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area conducive to farming and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough finances to boost business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs and also to pay farm employees. His business goal is to open a sales store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will meet his family's needs. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs and also pay farm employees.

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima, age 30, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a retailer. He owns a small general store in his community market which is the only source of income for the family. 

He needs to purchase a variety of items for his store like ice creams, sugar, salt, milk, flour and rice. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needful things. Therefore Saima, as a member of a two persons lending group, has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. Saima is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to purchase a variety of items like ice creams, sugar, salt, milk, flour and rice

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es: Adriana tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a ser comerciante independiente, inicialmente tenía un negocio de venta de frutas y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta lograr tener una tienda de abarrotes donde trabaja actualmente. Este negocio inició en un local arrendado, pero con los buenos resultados que ha dado, ella pudo ahorrar y convertirse en propietaria del local. La cliente se caracteriza por su entusiasmo y pujanza, su espíritu luchador la ha llevado a lograr sus objetivos y con el apoyo de algunos créditos anteriores ha hecho crecer su negocio. Por esta razón solicita su cuarto ciclo crediticio, con el que desea comprar mercancía al por mayor (café, granos, productos de aseo, mecato, confitería, lácteos, entre otros), de esta forma tendrá un inventario más variado y podrá satisfacer todas las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes, lo que incrementará su margen de utilidades por ventas. Adriana es una mujer soñadora y para lograr sus objetivos seguirá trabajando incansablemente para que en un futuro pueda cumplir el sueño de hacer crecer aún más su negocio y fusionarlo con un almacén en el mismo local, lo que le dará más rentabilidad y podrá dar a sus hijos una mejor educación y disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida con las personas que ama.
texts.en:
Adriana, 33, is married with two children. Throughout her productive life, she has worked as an independent vendor. She started with a business selling fruits and it slowly grew until she had a grocery store, which is where she works now. Her business started in a rented space, but due to the positive results of her business, she was able to save and become the owner of the space. Adriana is enthusiastic and thriving. She has a hard-working mentality that has allowed her to reach her goals. Also, the support from some previous loans helped her business grow.

Therefore, Adriana is requesting her fourth loan so she can buy wholesale merchandise including coffee, grains, personal hygiene products, pastries, sweets, dairy products, and more. This will give her a wider variety of inventory so she can meet all her customers' needs and preferences. This will increase her profit margin in sales. Adriana is a dreamer and to achieve her goals, she will keep working tirelessly so that in the future, she can fulfill her dream of growing her business even more with this grocery store in the same location. This will be more profitable and she will be able to provide her children with a better education. She will also be able to provide a better quality of life to those she loves.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise including coffee, grains, personal hygiene products, pastries, sweets, dairy products, and more.

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo is 27 years old, married, and blessed with a child. For the past six years, he has run a retail shop. Kyalo’s monthly income is 5,600 KES. 

Kyalo is requesting a loan to buy more stock of sugar, tea leaves, and cooking oil to sell. This is his third loan. Kyalo will use the profit from his loan to generate more income to expand his business and pay school fees for his child. In the future, he hopes to provide a good education for his child as well as provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea leaves, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is 41 years old and a single father of two children age 7 and 2 years. 

He has a retail shop in Nairobi town that he has been running for two and half years now, and he currently makes a monthly income of KES 36,000. 

He plans to use the loan to add stock of goods for selling. These include sugar, flour, detergents, cooking oil and rice. He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his business. This is his third loan term and he repaid all his previous loans successfully.  

Luka hopes to open a supermarket and take good care of his family.

loans.use: To add stock of goods for selling.

loans.name: Steve

texts.en:
Steve is a 36-year-old man from Migori, which is found in the Western part of Kenya. He supports 3 people in his family and is married to Mrs. Pamela who also has small businesses to support the family. They have 3 children.

He is a carpenter. He has been doing this for the last 10 years and gets a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has requested his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to expand the business. He will use the anticipated income to expand the business and repay the loan.

His dream is to expand and become more stable in the business.

loans.use: to increase his working capital

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 45 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. For the past five years, she has earned a living by raising chickens in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming rice and pig fattening. 

Josie is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Yolima Vanesa

texts.es: Yolima es una mujer de 35 años de edad que se dedica a elaborar y comercializar alimentos fritos como empanadas, palitos de queso, morcilla, entre otros, esta actividad la realiza desde su lugar de residencia donde recibe ayuda de sus padres y con los ingresos que esto le genera puede aportar a la economía de su hogar. Esta actividad la aprendió de manera empírica, por el método de prueba/error y hasta el momento le ha dado buenos resultados, pero su principal desafío es la competencia que tiene en el sector, pues existen muchas personas que se dedican a actividades similares a la suya, sin embargo esto no la detiene para seguir avanzando. Su actitud emprendedora y sus ganas de superarse la impulsan a solicitar el crédito con el que desea comprar insumos al por mayor (verduras, carne, aceite, salsas) y cambiar los activos fijos (freidora, asador), con lo que tendrá materia prima disponible para elaborar los productos y satisfacer la demanda, especialmente los fines de semana donde tiene más afluencia de clientes; de esta forma podrá aumentar sus ingresos personales y tendrá la posibilidad de continuar acreditando su negocio, pues sueña con posicionarse en el mercado ofreciendo productos de excelente calidad, que sean reconocidos y que le dé una mejor rentabilidad para que le permita disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de sus padres.
texts.en: Yolima, 35, makes a living from making and selling fried food such as empanadas, cheese sticks, sausage, and more. She completes this work from her home where she has help from her parents. The income that she earns contributes to household expenses. She learned this skill in an empirical manner, using trial and error until she got good results. Her primary challenge is the competition in this sector because there are many people with similar businesses. However, this doesn't stop her from advancing. Her enterprising attitude and her desire to improve led her to request a loan to buy wholesale products such as vegetables, meat, cooking oil, and sauces, and to replace fixed assets including a deep-fryer and a grill. This will provide her with the materials she needs to make her products and satisfy customer demand, especially on the weekends when she has more customers. This will increase her personal income and she will have the opportunity to keep growing her business. She dreams of positioning herself in the market offering excellent quality products that will be recognized and more profitable so she will have a better quality of life along with her parents.

loans.use: to buy wholesale products such as vegetables, meat, cooking oil, and sauces; to replace fixed assets including a deep-fryer and a grill.

loans.name: Claudia Milena

texts.es: Claudia es una estilista de 34 años de edad, que se ha dedicado durante su vida productiva a trabajar en diferentes peluquerías. Inició el aprendizaje de esta labor desde muy joven, porque su familia pasaba por una difícil situación económica y además quedó en embarazo a los 14 años de edad, por lo que necesitaba emplearse para generar ingresos para suplir los gastos de su bebé y aportar a la economía de su hogar. Luego de haber tomado sus primeras clases de belleza en una academia, se empleó en una peluquería y, posteriormente se capacitó y se especializó, ampliando sus conocimientos y abriendo más posibilidades en el campo laboral. Luego de trabajar como empelada por varios años, decidió independizarse y comenzó a prestar sus servicios a domicilio. Su empuje, empeño y su espíritu emprendedor y las ganas de superarse la han llevado a buscar opciones que le permitan salir adelante, es por ello que solicita un quinto ciclo de crédito, con el que desea comprar activos fijos (espejos, vitrinas), insumos y mercancía al por mayor (tinturas, shampoo, tratamientos capilares, accesorios para el cabello) y realizar adecuaciones locativas, todo esto le permitirá crecer su negocio, pues desea montar su propia sala de belleza en un espacio de su casa, donde prestará el servicio y sus clientes podrán disfrutar de mayor comodidad. Todo esto dará como resultado un incremento en los ingresos, con los que podrá seguir aportando a la economía familiar y podrá brindarle una mejor educación a su hijo ya adolescente. Claudia sueña con fortalecer y hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en una gran sala de belleza, que sea reconocida y rentable y, que le permita ofrecer oportunidades de empleo a otras personas. Así mejorará la calidad de vida de muchas otras personas, incluyendo su familia.
texts.en: Claudia is 34 years old and a stylist, work she has done throughout her working life in different hairdressing salons.  Claudia started learning this trade when she was very young as her family were having financial difficulties and Claudia had fallen pregnant at 14.  Because of this Claudia needed a job in order to earn an income to pay for the baby and support the family's finances.  After starting beautician classes at a local institute, Claudia found work in a hairdressing salon and, later, did further training and specialisations, increasing her knowledge and opening up the path to more possibilities in the working world.  After working as an employee for a number of years, Claudia decided to go it alone and started to offer her services, going round to her customers' homes.  Her determination and enterprising spirit, and her desire to do better, have led Claudia to look for opportunities to get ahead.  So, she is applying for her fifth loan, which she will use to buy fixed assets (mirrors, display cases), and supplies and merchandise in bulk (dyes, shampoo, hair treatments, hair accessories); she will also make improvements to her premises.  All this will allow Claudia's business to grow as she wants to start her own beauty salon in her home.  There she will provide service to her customers, who will be more comfortable. All of this will result in an increase in sales, which she can use to continue supporting the family finances.  Claudia will also be able to offer her son, who is in his teenage years, a better education.  Claudia dreams of strengthening and expanding her business.  She wants to turn it into a great beauty salon that is well-known and profitable, and then to be able to offer jobs to other people.  In this way she can improve many other people's quality of life, including her family's

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (mirrors, display cases), and supplies and merchandise in bulk (dyes, shampoo, hair treatments, hair accessories); she will also make improvements to her premises.

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Group

texts.en:
Federsi is widow, age 56, looking after the 2 children of her late daughter and a member of Tukolere Wamu Group. She has a bar that sells a local brew locally known as "malwa’,’ waragi liquor, beer, and sodas. Additionally, she has three rooms for rent. The bar  has been open since 2003, and is strategically located on a busy street. It has attracted a significant number of customers. The bar is the main source of income for Federsi and her family. Weather and competition from others are the major challenges for her business. She will use the loan to replenish her pub with more drinks such that she will increase her income.
With her hard working character, she has always aimed to maintain and expand her business. and eventually open two more branches and other areas.

loans.use: to replenish her stock of beverages.

loans.name: Zeba

texts.en:
Zeba is a 35-year-old woman. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a retailer. He owns a small general store in his community market. It is the only source of income for the family. 

He needs to purchase more variety of items for his store like ice creams, sugar, salt, milk, flour and rice. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needful things. Therefore, Zeba has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. 

Zeba is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to purchase a variety of stock like ice creams, sugar, salt, milk, flour and rice for her husband's store.

loans.name: Luz Bibiana

texts.es: Luz es una ama de casa de 34 años de edad, casada y madre de cuatro hijos. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una venta de alimentos fritos que ella misma elabora, los prepara en su casa y los vende en la vía pública. Esta actividad la inició de manera empírica, sólo con el ánimo de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica de su hogar. Es una mujer pujante, dedicada y luchadora, día a día se enfrenta a los diferentes riesgos a los que está expuesta en la vía pública con el único fin de velar por el bienestar de sus hijos, quienes son su principal motivación para seguir adelante. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar utensilios de cocina (olllas, sartén, cucharas, cuchillos) y para comprar insumos al por mayor (verduras, carne, pollo, harina, salsas), esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y podrá ampliar su portafolio de productos, para satisfacer los diversos gustos de los comensales y poder atraer nuevos y potenciales clientes entre las personas que transitan por el sector. Todo esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ingresos, con los que podrá continuar aportando económicamente en su hogar y además tendrá la posibilidad de ahorrar para que, en un futuro a mediado plazo pueda cumplir el sueño de tener su negocio en un local, donde podrá brindar mayor calidad en el servicio y los comensales podrán sentirse más cómodos. De esta manera, Luz se esfuerza cada día más para lograr lo que se propone y poder brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Luz is a homemaker who is 34 years old, married, and the mother to four children. Currently, she makes a living working in her own business, a shop that sells fried foods that she herself prepares. She prepares them in her home and sells them in public on the street. She began this activity empirically, only with the intention of generating an income to support her husband in the economic burden of their home. 

She is a thriving, dedicated, and tenacious woman.  Day to day, she faces the different risks to which she is exposed on the street with her only goal being to safeguard the wellbeing of her children, who are her main motivation for continuing ahead. 

She is requesting the support of the loan to purchase kitchen utensils (pots, pans, spoons, knives) and to purchase supplies wholesale (vegetables, meat, chicken, flour, salsas). This will allow her to improve her work conditions and to be able to expand her portfolio of products to satisfy the diverse tastes of her diners and to be able to attract new and potential customers from the people who travel through the area. 

All of this will be seen reflected in the increase of her income, with which she will be able to continue contributing economically to her home. She will also have the possibility of saving for, in the medium-term future, the ability to achieve her dream of having her business in a store where she will be able to provide a better quality of service and diners will be able to feel more comfortable. For this, Luz makes more of an effort each day to be able to achieve what she has proposed and to be able to provide a better well-being to her family.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils (pots, pans, spoons, knives) and to purchase supplies wholesale (vegetables, meat, chicken, flour, sauces).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more nipa or native palm to weave.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is a 48-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with 4 children. The youngest is 11 years old. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items ranging from biscuits, eggs, and cooking oil to energy drinks and soap. Her business started more than 5 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy various goods like powdered milk, sugar, and toiletries to attract more customers.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy various goods like powdered milk, sugar, and toiletries

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is a single woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as being calm. She operates a grocery store where she sells maize and carrots. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are hotels, schools and other retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to boost business. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add more to her stock of maize for resale. Her business goal is to expand her business to other areas within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will meet her family's daily needs. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add purchase maize for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old and a single mother of one child. 

She is a charcoal seller and has been running the business for seven years. She plans to use this loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for selling. 

This is her first loan, and she plans to use the profits to start another business. 

Ruth's future hopes and dreams are to buy a plot of land and have a stable business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 6 years to 15 years. He describes himself as humble. 

He operates a farm where he grows potatoes and carrots to sell. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a highly populated area with fertile land and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds to boost business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. His business goal is to expand his farm within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will meet the demands of the customers. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 39-year-old woman. She describes herself to be tolerant. She operates a retail shop where she sells maize flour, wheat flour, juices, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to expand her business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase stock of maize flour, wheat flour, and other items. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a business that serves all people. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize flour, wheat flour, and other items

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en: Scolastica is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be able. She operates a retail stall where she sells cooking oil. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a market area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more cooking oil to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of cooking oil within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil for sale

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Dolores works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Dolores is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es: José, tiene 39 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Protección, Santa Barbara. Hace 25 años que se dedica a la caficultura y agricultura produce  café, maíz y frijol. La produccion la vende en  zona. El prestamo que solicita es por 8,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para la finca de cafe y asi poder obtener mejores cosechas y  ganancias,  Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida en su familia.
texts.en: José is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in the Protección municipality in Santa Barbara.  For 25 years José has made a living in agriculture, growing coffee, corn, and beans.  He sells his crops in the local area.  José is applying for a loan of 8000 Lempira that he will invest in buying supplies and fertilisers for the coffee crops.  With these items he will have better harvests and higher profits.  José's aim is to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser to help his coffee crops.

loans.name: Kinguu

texts.en:
Kinguu is 43 years old, married and has five children. He supports eight people. 

He has a motorcycle transport business in Tala town and a poultry business as well. He has been in the transport business for three years. 

This being his second loan, he will be using it to service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition. He will also buy more stock of poultry. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and repay the loan. 

His dream for the future is to buy a taxi and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle and also buy poultry for rearing.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 56 years old, married, and the mother of four children. 

Amelita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and rice in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Amelita has been farming vegetables and rice for five years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amelita would like to save more money to renovate her family's house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 60 years old, married and has six children. Nida works very hard to provide for them.

Nida runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as bread, eggs, spices and other groceries.

Nida requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

In the future Nida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Policarpia

texts.en:
Policarpia earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place in Talibon, Bohol. 

Policarpia needs a loan for her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap, and toiletries among others. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to cater to the needs of her customers. 

In the future, Policarpia has hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Mevludi

texts.en:
Mevludi is applying for a loan to start up a bakery in his village and bake traditional Georgian bread: shoti. He is a 55-year-old farmer and cultivates a plot of land where maize is grown. He works hard the whole year to generate income for his family members: his wife, grown son, daughter-in-law, two grandchildren, and a retired mother.

Mevludi's wife is a consultant at the local farmers' center and his son is employed by the emergency center in return for small monthly salaries. The family incomes are modest and that is the reason why Mevludi decided to start this business. He estimates his business will be lucrative as there is high demand for bread in his village. 

Mevludi is happy for this startup loan that is offered to poor people for improving their living conditions in future.

loans.use: to start a bakery and bake Georgian bread

loans.name: Kisakye Group

texts.en:
Fiona is a 33-year-old female and a mother of 3 children. She is a resident of Nabbingo Ttega zone and a member of Kisakye group. She is involved in the green banana selling businesses in Nabbingo. She ventured into this business in 2008. Her husband has a temporary job as a taxi driver, and he encouraged her to begin the business so she can help him to look after the family because his earnings were inadequate to sustain the whole family.

Fiona is a hardworking lady, and her hope is to expand the business as well as encourage her husband to join her in the venture so as to become self reliant with their own business.

She approached Ugafode for a loan of 400,000 UGX to buy more stock of bananas for her business

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Regenita

texts.en:
Regenita is engaged in seaweed farming in her place in Talibon, Bohol. She works with her husband in overseeing their seaweed farming. Regenita has three children ages 12, 9 and 2.
 
Regenita is asking for a loan to buy more seaweed seedlings for her business. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of their seaweed farm thus augmenting their yield and income. In the future, Regenita hopes to make her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed seedlings for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Jane has been in this business for two years.  Jane earns more income from raising pigs.

Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Salamatu from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. One of her children is going to school. After the war, Salamatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the transportation problem.

Salamatu requires a loan to buy more clothing material for males and females to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future; Salamatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material for males and females to expand her business.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 30 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has two children ages 3 months and 16 years old. They all live with her and only the older one is attending school. 

For four years now she has been selling sugar, candy, chewing gum, biscuits, etc. She sells from the morning hours to the evening hours every day. She enjoys having her own money. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more sugar, candy, chewing gum, biscuits, etc. In the future, she wants to be her own boss and wants her children to live a good life. She thanks BRAC Liberia for their continuous support.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, candy, chewing gum, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been sewing leather gloves for the past 5 years to support her family. She beautifully sews gloves at home and then sells them in the local market with the help of her husband. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband is a driver by profession and drives an auto rickshaw. He also delivers the handmade glove to the market with his rickshaw.

She is a mother of 5 children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase stocks of leather. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She is in her first loan cycle, and she assures us that she will show an excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

Shamshad says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy leather for sewing gloves to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Rebecca from Tombo, a western rural area in Freetown.  She is married and blessed with 2 children between the ages 5 and 11 years.  She started her cooked food sales business to get daily meals for her family. 

Rebecca runs a cooking business at home; she sells cooked food at her house.  She has been running this business since the war.  She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night.  Rebecca says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Rebecca has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business.  In the future, she plans to build a house.  She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a first time borrower applying for 2,000,000 UGX. He is a single father aged 33 years with one child. He operates a small cosmetics shop along the streets of the city. 

In this business, he has one major challenge of small working capital that has always made him unable to meet all his customers’ demands. He therefore goes ahead to apply for the loan to stock up on the various cosmetic products that are highly demanded by his customers. This will boost his sales and thus the profit margin.

Julius has hope of seeing his shop grow into a very big one that can help him meet all his domestic and family needs, including purchasing land and having a residential house constructed on it.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as innovative. He operates a fuel business where he sells kerosene. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to expand the business. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more kerosene for resale. His business goal is to buy another kerosene pump within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more kerosene to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kerosene for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plywood and epoxy (adhesive)

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 29-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be trustworthy. 

She operates a poultry farm where she keeps chickens for selling and also laying chickens that produce eggs for selling. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a high demand which she is unable to meet. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to add more stock of chickens. Her business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of chickens.

loans.use: buy more stock of chickens

loans.name: Marlito

texts.en:
Marlito is a 30-year-old man from the town of Getafe, Bohol.  He is married with 2 children ages 7 and 3. 

He engages in the motorcycle transport services business.  He earns a living by transporting passengers from one place to another for a certain fee.  His  business started 5 years ago.  He is asking for a loan to buy tires, and complete maintenance items like change the oil and chain. 

In the future, he hopes to expand his business and increase business profitability for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy tires, and complete maintenance items like change the oil and chain.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a 26-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 1 year old. She describes herself to be honest and obedient. She is a hawker and she sells new clothes on the streets. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Hilda describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in clothes fashion within a short time which affect her sales. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add a stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family economy. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add a stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly runs a small eatery in her hometown in Talibon, Bohol. She sells home-cooked food to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Shirly is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients and cooking materials such as rice, meat, cooking oil, seasonings, etc. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more, thus augmenting her income.

In the future, Shirly hopes to make her business a success and a stable source of her income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and cooking materials such as rice, meat, cooking oil, seasonings, etc., to make food to sell

loans.name: Komborero Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Ledwin from Masvingo. She is a member of Komborero Group. She is married with three children and two are attending school. She also cares for two other dependents. Ledwin runs an agriculture related business producing chikens. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the greatest challenge being faced are the unclearly defined markets. Ledwin has requested a loan of $1000 to buy building materials for the construction of a fowl run. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will provide her with an increase in income and hence improve the family welfare. In the future, Ledwin plans to keep 1500 birds in different batches.

loans.use: to buy building material to build a chicken run

loans.name: María Patricia

texts.es: María, a sus 45 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos y cabeza de hogar desde que esposo la abandonó. Se ha dedicado durante 10 años a elaborar artesanías tanto manualmente como con máquina de coser, hace diversos artículos como acolchados, sábanas, bolsos, balacas y otros; la actividad la aprendió de manera empírica con el método de prueba/error y, poco a poco fue mejorando su técnica; de esta manera ha generado los recursos suficientes para suplir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.  Su actitud positiva, su empeño y dedicación la han llevado a sobrepasar duras pruebas, sin embargo cada día lucha con más ganas para dar lo mejor a sus hijos. Solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar activo fijo (máquina de coser) e insumos al por mayor (hilos, resortes, tela), de esta forma podrá mejorar el tiempo de producción y facilitará la elaboración de sus productos, lo que afectará positivamente la entrada de recursos económicos, producto de las ventas realizadas. María sueña con fortalecer y hacer crecer su negocio, para que sea más rentable y le permita tener una estabilidad económica favorable, para solventar las necesidades básicas y dar una mejor educación a  sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, at 45-years-old is a mother of 2 children and the head of the household since her husband abandoned her. She has been working 10 years making crafts either by hand or with a sewing machine. She makes several items like quilts, blankets, bags, headbands and other things.

She learned her type of work by experience with trial and error and gradually improved her technique. This allowed her to generate enough resources to meet the basic needs of her home.

Her positive attitude, commitment, and dedication have led her to overcome hardships. However, she struggles every day but is more eager to give the best to her children. 

She is applying for the loan with the purpose to buy fixed assets (a sewing machine) and supplies at wholesale (wires, springs, and fabric). This way, she will be able to improve her production time and make it easier to make her products. This will positively affect the input of her economic resources, the carrying out of product sales.

Maria dreams of enhancing and growing her business so that it would be more profitable and allow her to have a favorable economic stability to address basic needs and provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (sowing machine) and supplies at wholesale (wires, springs, and fabric).

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be self motivated. He operates a grinding mill where he sells maize flour. He also sells cooking oil, sugar, kerosene and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough money. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of maize, cooking oil, and other items for resale. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big business. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to start a new business.

loans.use: to add stock of maize, cooking oil, and other items for resale

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 30-year-old married man. He has a child who is 2 months old. He describes himself as focused and honest. He operates a retail stall where he sells new shoes. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low demand of shoes. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to add stocks of shoes for resale. His business goal is to own a shoe shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have many shoe shops. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to add stocks of shoes for resale

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Prescilla works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable-selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Prescilla is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF in order to purchase more vegetables to sell for her selling vegetables business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is a 46-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children. The youngest child is 7 years old. Her husband is a fisherman.

She  also engages in fishing.She catches and sells fish  to help augment the income of their household. Her business started ten years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy nylon, fishing nets, and  lift weights.

In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing  business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy nylon, fishing nets, and  lift weights for fishing

loans.name: Roquillo

texts.en:
Roquillo is a 40-year-old man from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is married with six children. The youngest child is 12 years old.

He engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish, seashells and crab in order to help augment the income of their household. His business started more than 10 years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net, lift weights and epoxy (adhesive) to increase his daily catch.

In the future, he hopes to expand his fishing business and increase the business's profitability for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, lift weights and epoxy (adhesive)

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 40 years old and married with two children between the age of 10 and 16. She sells domestic products in Tombo in the Western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since after the war and sells lunch bowls and food containers within the community.  She says that the main problem for her business is improper business location.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more lunch bowls and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more lunch bowls and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman and a mother of five children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.

Susana is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other things. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Susana hopes to make her business a success so that it will generate more income necessary for their needs like food and to pay the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other things

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 47 years old. He lives in the village of Tsodniskari with his wife, two children and his mother. George's son goes to the local public school and his daughter attends university. His wife is employed at the village school as a teacher and gets a monthly income. George is busy with agricultural activities. He cultivates the plot of land and sows maize, cabbages, eggplants, and watermelons seasonally. He works hard the whole year and harvests the quality products which are sold to vegetable retailers. Additionally, the family runs an animal husbandry business and breeds a milk cow, two calves, and two pigs. 

With this loan, George would like to purchase a tractor. He will use it to perform agricultural work on the lands of nearby farmers, mainly in tilling and sowing seasons, and will be paid by the landlords. He will save any profits generated by the tractor and continue to cultivate his own land. He expects that this loan will significantly increase his family's income and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Shahrikhon

texts.ru: Шахрихон 44 года. Она всю свою жизнь провела стараясь во благо своей семьи, своих детей. У нее 22-летний сын и 19-летняя дочь. Муж Шахрихона работает водителем грузовой машины. Он перевозит камень, песок, гравий для строительных работ. Ее сын работает заграницей. Единственная дочь Шахрихона помогает ей в торговле. Шахрихон вот уже 12 лет как занимается продажей носков, чулок, колготок, бриджей т.д. В данный момент Шахрихон собирается расширить свой торговый бизнес. Она хочет приобрести лавку для продажи одежды на рынке города Исфары для своей дочери, а также закупить товар из города Худжанда и Истаравшана, и тем самым пополнить новую лавку своей дочери товаром.
texts.en: Shahrikhon is 44 years old. She has spent her whole life trying to help her family and her children. She has a 22 year-old son and a 19 year-old daughter. Shahrikhon's husband works as a lorry driver. He transports rocks, sand and gravel for use as building materials. Her son works abroad. Shahrikhon's only daughter helps her with her business. Shahrikhon has been selling socks, stockings, tights, breeches etc for 12 years now. At the moment Shahrikhon plans to expand her trading business. She wants to buy a clothes stall for her daughter to run in the market of the the city of Isfara. She also wants to buy goods from the cities Khujand and Istaravshan in order to stock her daughter's new stall.

loans.use: to open a new market stall.

loans.name: Norelia

texts.es: Norelia es una ama de casa de 62 años de edad, madre de dos hijos y cabeza de hogar desde que su esposo falleció hace algunos años. Con el ánimo de emplearse y generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades de su hogar, ella comenzó a elaborar comidas para eventos especiales y desde hace 2 meses complementa su actividad vendiendo productos por catálogo y accesorios de bisutería, los ingresos son el resultado de ambas actividades y con él paga las cuentas y solventa las necesidades familiares; sus principales clientes son los compañeros de trabjao de una de sus hijas. Su empeño, empuje y dedicación le han permitido avanzar y cumplir los objetivos que se propone, es por ello que se anima a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (accesorios, cosméticos, perfumería, entre otros), de esta forma aumentará su portafolio de productos y podrá satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de los clientes, dando como resultado el incremento en los ingresos que recibe por cada venta. Esto le permite a Norelia, poder seguir trabajando fuertemente para lograr cumplir el sueño de ahorrar y montar una miscelánea donde pueda vender todos sus productos y seguir percibiendo ingresos para dar a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Norelia is a 62-year-old housewife and mother of two children. She is the head of the household since her husband passed away a few years.
With the intention of employing and generating revenues to sustain the needs of her home, she began to prepare meals for special events. Two months ago, she started selling products and jewelry accessories through a catalogue. The income is the result of both jobs and with it she pays the bills and cares for the basic needs of the family. 

Her main customers are coworkers of one of her daughters. Her determination, drive, and dedication have enabled progress toward meeting her set goals. This is why she is encouraged to apply for the loan to invest in buying wholesale merchandise (accessories, cosmetics, perfumes, etc.). In this manner, she will increase her product portfolio and be able to meet the needs and preferences of her customers, resulting in increased revenue she receives for each sale.
